verses.kjv: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he gathered of the house of Judah and Benjamin an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, which were warriors, to fight against Israel, that he might bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
verses.ct: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he assembled 180,000 elite fighting men from the tribes of Judah and Benjamin to wage war against Israel and reclaim the kingdom for himself.

verses.kjv: But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.ct: But the LORD spoke to Shemaiah, the man of God, with this message:

verses.kjv: Speak unto Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
verses.ct: "Tell Rehoboam son of Solomon, king of Judah, and all the Israelites living in Judah and Benjamin:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return every man to his house: for this thing is done of me. And they obeyed the words of the LORD, and returned from going against Jeroboam.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: 'You must not march out or fight against your brothers. Everyone go home, because I am the one who made this happen.'" So they listened to what the LORD said and turned back from attacking Jeroboam.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defence in Judah.
verses.ct: Rehoboam settled in Jerusalem and constructed fortified cities throughout Judah.

verses.kjv: He built even Bethlehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
verses.ct: He built up Bethlehem, Etam, and Tekoa,

verses.kjv: And Bethzur, and Shoco, and Adullam,
verses.ct: along with Bethzur, Shoco, and Adullam,

verses.kjv: And Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph,
verses.ct: as well as Gath, Mareshah, and Ziph,

verses.kjv: And Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
verses.ct: and also Adoraim, Lachish, and Azekah,

verses.kjv: And Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin fenced cities.
verses.ct: plus Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron — all fortified cities in the territories of Judah and Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And he fortified the strong holds, and put captains in them, and store of victual, and of oil and wine.
verses.ct: He strengthened these fortifications, placed commanders in each one, and stocked them with food, olive oil, and wine.

verses.kjv: And in every several city he put shields and spears, and made them exceeding strong, having Judah and Benjamin on his side.
verses.ct: In every city he stored shields and spears, making them extremely well defended. So Judah and Benjamin remained under his control.

verses.kjv: And the priests and the Levites that were in all Israel resorted to him out of all their coasts.
verses.ct: The priests and Levites from across all of Israel came to join him from every region where they lived.

verses.kjv: For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons had cast them off from executing the priest’s office unto the LORD:
verses.ct: The Levites abandoned their pasturelands and property and moved to Judah and Jerusalem, because Jeroboam and his sons had removed them from serving as priests of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he ordained him priests for the high places, and for the devils, and for the calves which he had made.
verses.ct: Jeroboam had appointed his own priests for the hilltop shrines, for the demon-idols, and for the calf statues he had made.

verses.kjv: And after them out of all the tribes of Israel such as set their hearts to seek the LORD God of Israel came to Jerusalem, to sacrifice unto the LORD God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Following the Levites, people from every tribe of Israel who were determined to seek the LORD God of Israel came to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices to the LORD, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong, three years: for three years they walked in the way of David and Solomon.
verses.ct: They strengthened the kingdom of Judah and supported Rehoboam son of Solomon for 3 years, because during those 3 years they followed the example of David and Solomon.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam took him Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David to wife, and Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse;
verses.ct: Rehoboam married Mahalath, the daughter of Jerimoth son of David, and also Abihail, the daughter of Eliab son of Jesse.

verses.kjv: Which bare him children; Jeush, and Shamariah, and Zaham.
verses.ct: She gave him these sons: Jeush, Shamariah, and Zaham.

verses.kjv: And after her he took Maachah the daughter of Absalom; which bare him Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith.
verses.ct: After her, he married Maachah the daughter of Absalom, and she gave birth to Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took eighteen wives, and threescore concubines; and begat twenty and eight sons, and threescore daughters.)
verses.ct: Rehoboam loved Maachah daughter of Absalom more than any of his other wives or secondary wives. (In total, he married 18 wives and had 60 secondary wives, and became the father of 28 sons and 60 daughters.)

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief, to be ruler among his brethren: for he thought to make him king.
verses.ct: Rehoboam designated Abijah, the son of Maachah, as the leader among his brothers, because he intended to make him the next king.

verses.kjv: And he dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his children throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin, unto every fenced city: and he gave them victual in abundance. And he desired many wives.
verses.ct: He acted shrewdly by distributing his sons throughout all the regions of Judah and Benjamin, stationing them in every fortified city. He provided them with generous supplies of food and secured many wives for them.
